meanings.definition: A wild canine native to North America.
meanings.sent1: The pack of coyotes howled in the moonlight.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of coyotes while hiking in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous coyotes played a game of hide-and-seek with the rabbits.
meanings.sent4: The coyotes' keen senses helped them survive in the harsh wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the coyotes running freely was a symbol of untamed nature.

meanings.definition: A person who smuggles immigrants across the US-Mexico border.
meanings.sent1: The coyotes led the group of immigrants through the desert.
meanings.sent2: Authorities arrested a notorious coyote at the border.
meanings.sent3: The cunning coyotes found a secret path through the mountains.
meanings.sent4: The coyotes' network helped many people cross the border unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The coyotes guided the migrants to safety under the cover of darkness.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives or outwits others.
meanings.sent1: Beware of the coyotes in the business world.
meanings.sent2: The sly coyote tricked his competitors with false information.
meanings.sent3: The clever coyotes always had a trick up their sleeves.
meanings.sent4: The coyotes' smooth talk could charm even the most cautious investors.
meanings.sent5: The coyotes' deceptive tactics were finally exposed by the authorities.
